newsitem.title: FRANCE: Gaz de France consortium wins Argentine contract.
newsitem.headline: Gaz de France consortium wins Argentine contract.

text.p: French state-owned gas group Gaz de France said a consortium which it led had won a tender for a contract to built, exploit and distribute gas in five provinces in the North-East of Argentina. It said the project would take total investments of about $150 million.
The consortium counts two units of Gaz De France, Gaseba SA with 15 percent and Gas del Sur SA with 55 percent, as well as two Argentine companies, Bridas and Emprigas.
The consortium plans to construct 3,000 km of distribution channels in 36 towns and could in the year 2010 service between 150,000 and 200,000 clients.
